page.title: 15Colston Bassett, Part Three.
page.content: The Colston Bassett Creamery produces 100 cheeses a day taking 1700 gals of milk. The cheeses, weighing approx. 14 1bs., win many prizes and are exported abroad. From the village we can see Belvoir Castle. This is excellent fox-hunting country with many hedges. The Belvoir Hunt meet here and the Quorn and South Notts Hunts ride through. We often see Prince Charles hunting. The Hall overlooks the Park and dominates the village. It is now privately owned and the grounds have been developed. The mobile library van calls weekly and there is a weekly bus to Bingham Market. The large Parish Church of St.John the Divine is in the Wiverton Group and has a service every Sunday. The bell-ringers come to use the full peal of bells ,recently restored.
